IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SHAPED BY CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES, MCMURRY UNIVERSITY CHALLENGES STUDENTS TO EXAMINE OUR COMPLEX WORLD FROM MULTIPLE PERSPECTIVES IN PREPARATION FOR LIVES OF LEADERSHIP, SERVICE AND PROFESSIONAL SUCCESS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SHAPED BY CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES, MCMURRY UNIVERSITY CHALLENGES STUDENTS TO EXAMINE OUR COMPLEX WORLD FROM MULTIPLE PERSPECTIVES IN PREPARATION FOR LIVES OF LEADERSHIP, SERVICE AND PROFESSIONAL SUCCESS.
IRS990.Desc: MCMURRY UNIVERSITY WAS FOUNDED IN 1923 BY THE UNITED METHODIST CHURCH. DURING THE 2022-2023 YEAR, THE UNIVERSITY CHALLENGED STUDENTS TO GROW ACADEMICALLY AND SOCIALLY WITH 66 ACADEMIC MAJORS AND 40 ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS. ALSO OFFERED TO OUR APPROXIMATELY 1,237 RACIALLY AND ETHNICALLY DIVERSE STUDENTS, ARE PROFESSIONAL PREPARATION PROGRAMS IN ATHLETIC TRAINING, ENGINEERING, ALLIED HEALTH, DENTISTRY, MEDICINE, OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY, PHARMACY, PHYSICAL THERAPY, VETERINARY MEDICINE, LAW, AND MINISTRY ALONG WITH A MASTERS OF ACCOUNTANCY AND A MASTERS OF SCIENCE IN NURSING IN EDUCATION OR FAMILY NURSE PRACTITIONER. THE UNIVERSITY IS PROUD TO OFFER A LOW STUDENT TO FACULTY RATIO OF 13 TO 1, AVERAGE CLASS SIZE OF 14 AND DOES NOT USE TEACHING ASSISTANTS IN THE CLASSROOMS. STUDENTS CAN EXPLORE INTERNATIONAL CULTURE BY PARTICIPATING IN AN ACTIVE NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL MODEL UN PROGRAM AND ANNUAL TRAVEL ABROAD EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. ALSO AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS IS A STUDENT-RUN ART GALLERY AND ARTWORK OWNED BY THE UNIVERSITY APPRAISED AT $164K. THE SCHOOL OF BUSINESS HAS RECENTLY RECEIVED A TEN MILLION DOLLAR ENDOWMENT AND BUSINESS STUDENTS AT MCMURRY CAN PARTICIPATE IN MANAGING A ONE MILLION DOLLAR INVESTMENT FUND.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: IN ADDITION TO EDUCATING STUDENTS, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ON CAMPUS HOUSING AND DINING SERVICES AS AUXILIARY SERVICES. DINING OPTIONS INCLUDE THREE ROBUST MEAL PLANS OFFERING STUDENTS COOK TO ORDER MENU ITEMS, VARIOUS COMMUTER PLANS AND THREE RETAIL OPTIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ATHLETIC PROGRAMS WITH A MISSION TO MAKE PERSONAL INVESTMENTS IN THE LIVES OF ALL SCHOLAR-ATHLETES AND USE THE INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS EXPERIENCE TO DEVELOP CHAMPIONS FOR LIFE. THE ATHLETIC PROGRAM CORE VALUES ARE RESPONSIBILITY, INTEGRITY, SERVICE AND EXCELLENCE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS ASSISTANCE WITH STUDENT AID, AS WELL AS FOSTERING RELATIONSHIPS WITH ALUMNI, WHICH BENEFIT OUR STUDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES STUDENT SERVICES THROUGH HEALTH AND WELLNESS, CAREER SERVICES, RELIGION AND SPIRITUAL LIFE, SOCIAL CLUBS, ACADEMIC SUCCESS AND STUDENT LIFE EXPERIENCES.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: OPERATING LEASE RIGHT OF USE ASSET
FINANCE LEASE RIGHT OF USE ASSET

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWED FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY AND TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO CURRENT AND FUTURE STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION DISCOUNTS 14,783,732. CONTRIBUTION TO ENDOWMENT 9,695,578.
THE UNIVERSITY PUBLISHES ITS NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG.
EXPLANATION OF GOVERNMENT FINANCIAL AID: THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES SUPPORT THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION THAT IS USED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

SCHOLARSHIPS - SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON SPECIFIC CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY, STUDENT SELECTION AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP. EACH SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT WILL BE MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO CONFIRM THAT THEY HAVE SATISFIED ALL SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES COUNTRY CLUB DUES AND UNIVERSITY-OWNED AUTO USE TO THE PRESIDENT, VICE PRESIDENT OF STUDENT AFFAIRS, ATHLETICS, AND VICE PRESIDENT OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT, WHICH IS COMMON FOR UNIVERSITIES. THIS IS CONSIDERED PART OF THEIR COMPENSATION. A HOUSING ALLOWANCE IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY'S PRESIDENT AND CHAPLAIN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 11B EXPLANATION - MANAGEMENT WILL PRESENT A COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD FOR DISCUSSION, REVIEW, AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY DURING THE FALL BOARD MEETING. ALL TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO BE FAMILIAR WITH THE POLICY AND DISCLOSE ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO THE ENTIRE BOARD AT THE EARLIEST PRACTICAL TIME. THE TRUSTEE SHALL ABSENT THEMSELVES FROM DISCUSSIONS OF AND ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON MATTERS IN WHICH THEY MAY HAVE A POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES USED COMPARATIVE PAY DATA WHEN SETTING THE COMPENSATION OF THE OFFICERS OF THE UNIVERSITY WHEN HIRED. AFTER THE OFFICERS ARE HIRED, INCREASES TO THEIR PAY ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S BUDGET AND THE PERCENTAGE INCREASE PAID TO OTHER UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY WILL MAKE AVAILABLE TO ANY STUDENT, FACULTY MEMBER, ALUMNI, OR OTHER INTERESTED PERSON A COPY OF THE UNIVERSITY'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING AT THE UNIVERSITY'S CAMPUS IN ABILENE, TX.
CHANGE IN SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -2,708,757. POSTRETIREMENT BENEFIT CHANGES -288,850.
